name: Patagonian Crested Duck
description: A slender duck with brown-beige plumage, a darker crown, and a distinctive small crest at the back of its head.
spread_note: Southernmost South America, including the Falkland Islands
proportions: Body length 51–61 cm, weight around 1 kg
attractions: Highly territorial, defending their nesting area against other birds. Nest on the ground in vegetation, with only the female incubating the eggs while both parents care for the young.
breeding: First kept in the zoo from 1984–2000, with successful breeding in 1992. The current breeding pair has raised several ducklings.
